text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 2.3.77.1 has been revised to include Program, Scope, and Objectives.
IRM 2.3.77, dated November 27, 2013, is superseded.
LB&I, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.
Table of Contents
Code ISTSE
page (
) Overview: This IRM section provides an overview of the ISTSE Command Code. and (
) Purpose: This IRM contains procedural steps for use of the ISTSE Code. An Innocent-Spouse-Tracking-Record is added to a module on IDRS whenever a Form
is ﬁled with the Service. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees who are responsible the processing of Innocent Spouse records. These employees are located in the following areas: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (
) Policy Owner: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for ing all aspects of or systems that operate the nation’s tax infrastructure. (
) Program Owner: MITS. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (

) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for employees who work with Innocent Spouse cases. By following the processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees process Innocent Spouse cases in a manner that follows IRS policy and dures while promoting the best interests of the Government. (
) ISTSE may be entered in two ways. Command Code ISTSR deﬁner S may asked to pass a case to ISTSE to be updated. See IRM
for details. No Command Code ISTSR with no deﬁner may be used to enter ISTSE when tiating or updating a case. See IRM

) Once ISTSE has been entered for an account, it is possible to continue through every module for the same case type (P or S) by entering the next module MFT and Tax Period. The returning screen will show the current of the new module case as well as the stage data just entered for the last case. See Exhibit

) ISTSE inputs, validates and stores data about the progress of the case through the examination process. It records the stages a case reaches as as comments about the case as it progresses. In addition, if a stage is changed or deleted, ISTSE marks it as such. (

) If the same update is to be applied to more than one case, ISTSE will the process. When the stage and/or comment information is entered, before transmitting it, also entered the MFT and tax period of the new Case. ISTSE will update the current case, and then present the review/input screen for the new case, with the stage data previously entered retained on the new Just tab to the end, and enter, or put in another tax period and MFT, and (
) The occasion for each stage and its optional and required input ﬁelds may found in Exhibit

) ISTSE provides a fast access to the command code that deletes Innocent Spouse cases, ISTSD. To access that command code for the current claim, a ’Y’ in the parentheses after the statement DELETE WHOLE CASE. (
) Internal Revenue Manual
Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment.
(01-01-2009) Using ISTSE With No Deﬁner
2.3 IDRS Terminal Responses

) ISTSE with deﬁner I is intended to be used by the Integrated Case System interface with the Innocent Spouse Tracking System. It allows multiple ISTSE With stages to be input at one time, and has a more compact but less user-friendly I format. See Exhibit
) Stage data optional and required data are the same as for ISTSE with No Deﬁner. (
) Up to
stages may be input at once with ISTSE Deﬁner I.

Exhibit 2.3.77-1 (Cont. 1) (07-01-2011) Returned From ISTSR (No Deﬁner)
BOD/AREA controlling the case. It is either the BOD/Area of the employee who entered the stage 01 or the BOD/Area in a stage 02 or 07 TO-AREA ﬁeld, whichever is later.
Stage number or comment ID from TIF 72
Stage date for Stage entry or start of comment from TIF 72 Note: Stages that can be entered more than once will have a letter after the stage number to differentiate among them.

Note: Stage data will be presented in a formatted version. Stages 01, 03, 04, 05, 06, 10, 15, 19, 23, 27, 28 and 31 will have a literal identify- ing the stage they are marking. Stages 01, 08, 09, 25, 26, 29 and 30 will display the associated ACTIVITY-CD. Stages 11, 12, 16 and 20 will display the ADP-CD The IRC Section and the REASON-CD. Stages 02 and 07 will display a literal identifying whether it is a TO or a FROM AREA, the AREA and the optional ACTIVITY-CD.
’C’ if a stage or ﬁeld is to be changed, a ’D’ if a stage is to be deleted or leave blank if a new stage is to be entered.
number to be entered or the stage number and letter to be or deleted.
Activity code to be entered. Required for stages 08, 09, 25, 29 and 30, and stage 01 if CLAIM NUMBER is other than 01. Optional for stage 07. See Exhibit 2.3.77–3 for values
For Stage 02 or 07, and a transfer to an area office is being recorded, enter To AREA
For Stage 02 or 07, and a transfer is being acknowledged, enter the From AREA here
For stage 11, 12, 14 or 16, enter ’A’ if the claim is allowed, ’D’ if the claim is disallowed, and ’P’ if the claim is partially allowed.
For stage 11, 12, 16 or 20, enter the applicable IRC statute section. Exhibit 2.3.77–4
stage 11, 12, 14 or 16, and the ADP code entered was ’P’ or the Reason code here. See Exhibit 2.3.77–4
Allowed Relief Amount. Optional for Stages 12, 16 or 20. Enter the amount of the claim allowed here. Only signiﬁcant digits are without $ or commas.
Disallowed Relief Amount. Optional for stage 12, 16 or 20. Enter the amount of the claim disallowed. Only signiﬁcant digits are required, without $ or commas.
FORM-CD. For Stage 1, if the claim number is 01 an entry of 0 will display OLDFORM and an entry of 1 will display NEWFORM.
Comment. At least 3 characters in length. May be Alpha, Numeric or special characters.
Claimant’s STATE. Standard two character abbreviation. Required when Case is started.
Secondary TIN. Enter the TIN of the Secondary Taxpayer. Required when case is started.
Number of UNIT working the case. Expected when case is started and with stage 02 or stage 07 FROMAREA. If it is not input then, it is assumed to be 000.
MFT of next module in current account to be updated.

Tax Period of next module in current account to be updated. If the update is to be made to the next tax module as to the current one, specify the next tax module when the input of the current stage and/or comment is being entered. The return screen will show the next case, with the input ﬁelds already populated with the desired data.
Name Control. Required with a new case for which there is no account (TIF Entity Record) present.
Screen Display:
Exhibit 2.3.77-2 (Cont. 1) (07-01-2011) ISTSEI Screen
Exhibit 2.3.77-2 (Cont. 1) ISTSEI Screen
Filer code. Either P for Primary or S for Secondary. Required.
Number of the claim for this taxpayer for this tax period. Blank, or 01-99. Required.
Secondary taxpayer SSN (XXX-XX-XXXX). Required for new case.
abbreviation for claimant. Required for new case.
Name Control. Required when account is not present on the TIF.
Unit. Required for new case being input at a location other than it will be worked.
Area. Required for new case being input at a location other than where it will be worked.
Stage data or comment content (may extend for 24
Exhibit 2.3.77-2 (Cont. 2) (07-01-2011) ISTSEI Screen

a stage date is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must be in a case. The STATE-CD of the claimant must be entered. The SSN of the taxpayer must be entered. UNIT from where case is being input from be entered. Only one Stage 01 is permitted. Name Control is required is no account on the TIF.
Stage 02

8857 has been transferred or acknowledges receipt in another office. may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must have been entered previously. TO- or FROM-AREA must be entered, but not both, and must be valid. Multiple 02 are permitted. UNIT may be entered if TO-AREA is entered. If it is not it is assumed to be 000. ACTIVITY-CODE is optional, but when entered,
Appeals-Primary Taxpayer. see exhibit 2.3.77-5 for values of xx
Appeals-Secondary Taxpayer. see exhibit 2.3.77-5 for values of xx
Appeals-Both Taxpayers. see exhibit 2.3.77-5 for values
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2014) Stage Data

Form 8857 needs to be screened. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage must have been entered previously. Only one Stage 03 is permitted.

The administrative ﬁle and returns have been requested from Files, the non- requesting spouse has been sent a letter. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must have been entered previously. Multiple Stages 04 are permitted.

Case has been assigned to a group or an employee. Stage Date may be If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must have been entered previously. Multiple Stages 05 are permitted. Stage 05 must have valid ACTIVITY-CD. Valid ACTIVITY-CDs are ASSIGN, AUDTEMAIL, CORRSUSP, DOCREQ, PCRS, PCNRS, RSPRELIM, SPCLSRCH, TECH.
search requested for document
Stage 06

is being held in suspense awaiting a reply or action. Stage Date may be If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s be assumed. Stage 03 or 05 must have been entered previously. Multiple 06 are permitted. Valid ACTIVITY-CDs are
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2014) Stage Data
Other reason than those listed here

transfer or receipt of a case where the taxpayer has protested the determina- or another office has requested the case. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be 03 or 05 must have been entered previously. TO-AREA or FROM-AREA be entered, but not both, and must be valid. Multiple Stages 07 are ACTIVITY-CD is optional. See STAGE 02 for valid entries.

This stage has a dual tracking purpose. The ﬁrst update is when the case has been sent to local review and the second update is after it has been reviewed; the reviewer’s determination. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 03 or 05 must have been entered previously. Only one Stage 08 is permitted. ACTIVITY-CD may be entered. If it is not, ’TOREVU’ will be assumed. If it is entered, valid codes are:
Returned; not supported by facts
RNSF Returned; not supported by facts RNSL Returned; not supported by law ROTH Returned; Other RPRD Returned for account problem resolution MSRT Misrouted

This stage has a dual tracking purpose. The ﬁrst update is when the case has been sent to centralized review and the second update is, after it has been reviewed, the reviewer’s determination. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 05 or 30 must have been entered previously. ACTIVITY-CD may be entered. If it is not, ’TOREVU’ will be assumed. If it is entered, see Stage 08 for valid codes. one Stage 09 is permitted.

Case is being reworked. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 3, 11, 12, 15 or 30 must have been entered previously, or stage 08 or 09 with an Activity Code that begins with the letter ’R’. Multiple Stages 10 are permitted.

Preliminary determination has been issued. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must have been entered previously, but stage 29 must not. An ADP-CD and CODE-SECTION must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77.4 for valid entries. If ADP-CD is ’P’ or ’D’, a REASON-CD must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77.4 for valid entries. Only one Stage 11 is permitted per consideration.
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 3) (01-01-2014) Stage Data

Final determination has been issued. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 08 or 09 must have been entered previously, but stage 29 must not. An ADP-CD and CODE-SECTION must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77.4 for valid entries. If the ADP-CD is ’P’ or ’D’, a REASON-CD must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77–4 for valid entries. Multiple Stage 12 are permitted.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) allowed in stage 11/12. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 13 must be entered for stages 12 and may be entered for stage 11. The Determination made on the case must be to allow or partially allow the claim and the amount of the claim allowed will be entered in the AMT-ALLOWED ﬁeld.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) disallowed in stage 11/12. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 14 must be entered for stages 12 and may be entered for stage 11. The determination made on the case must be to disallow or partially allow the claim and the amount of the claim that has been disallowed will be entered in the AMT-DISALLOWED ﬁeld. Only one Stage 14 is permitted per consideration.

Case has been received in the Appeals Office. Stage date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be Stage 01 must have been entered previously. Only one Stage 15 is permitted per consideration.

Appeals has issued a determination letter. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 15 must have been entered previously. An ADP-CD and CODE-SECTION must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77–4 for valid entries. If the ADP-CD is ’P’ or ’D’, a REASON-CD must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77–4 for valid entries.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) allowed in stage 16. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 17 must be entered for stage 16 if the deter- mination made on the case is to allow or partially allow the claim and the amount of the claim allowed will be entered in the AMT-ALLOWED ﬁeld.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) disallowed in stage 16. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 18 must be entered for stage 16 if the Deter- mination made on the case is to disallow or partially allow the claim and the amount of the claim that has been disallowed will be entered in the AMT- DISALLOWED ﬁeld.

The requesting spouse has petitioned Tax Court. Stage date may be entered. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 01 must have been entered previ- ously. Only one Stage 19 is permitted per consideration.
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 4) (01-01-2014) Stage Data

Tax Court has issued a determination letter. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 19 must have been entered previously. An ADP-CD and CODE-SECTION must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77.4 for valid entries. If the ADP-CD is ’P’ or ’D’, a REASON-CD must be entered. See exhibit 2.3.77.4 for valid entries. Only one Stage 20 is permitted per consideration.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) allowed in stage 20. Stage Date may entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 21 must be entered for Stage 20 if the decision made on the case must is to allow or partially allow the claim. The amount of the claim allowed will be entered in the AMT-ALLOWED ﬁeld.

Relief amount (tax, penalties & interest) disallowed in stage 20. Stage Date be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 22 must be entered for stage 20 if the decision made on the case is to disallow or partially allow the claim and the amount of the claim that has been disallowed will be entered in the AMT- DISALLOWED ﬁeld.

SBSE Post-Assessment case transferred to CCISO. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 11 or 12 must already be entered. More than 1 stage 23 is allowed. Unit may be entered.

Automated Under reporter. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 1 must already be entered. Multiple Stages 24 are allowed. ACTIVITY-CD must be entered. Valid ACTIVITY-CDs are:
Reconsideration case
Lantz court case

Reconsideration. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 11, 12, 29 or 30 must already be entered. Multiple Stage 25 are allowed. ACTIVITY-CD must be entered. Valid ACTIVITY-CDs are:
All
Provisions not considered IRS Error Original return not processed when claim received Claims being considered due to the M
ee Court

Determinations that cannot be processed. Stage Date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not entered, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 03 must already be entered. More than 1 stage 26 is allowed. ACTIVITY-CD must be entered. Valid ACTIVITY-CDs are:
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 5) (01-01-2014) Stage Data

Post Determination. This stage will be used while the case is in the closing unit, during the time period while they are determining the amounts and codes for form 12810. Unit must be entered. Stage date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 11, 12, 16, 20 or 29 must have been entered previously. More than one Stage 27 is permitted.

MFT 31 Processing. This stage will be used when waiting for the transfer process to MFT 31. Stage date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. Stage 27 must have been entered previously. Only one Stage 28 is permitted.

8857 is non-qualifying. This stage is used when it is determined that the fails to meet Innocent-Spouse eligibility. Stage date may be entered. If it is, not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. 01 must have been entered previously. ACTIVITY-CD must be entered and the reason the case could not be considered. Only one Stage 29 is per consideration. Valid Activities are:
Account problems needs correction, no innocent issue
Exhibit 2.3.77-3 (Cont. 6) (01-01-2014) Stage Data
Stage 30

Case Closed. This stage will be used when all action is complete on the request. Stage date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous stage. If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. If the case was closed as non-qualifying, a stage 29 must have been entered. Multiple Stages 30 are permitted. ACTIVITY-CD is required and must be one of the following:
No reply from taxpayer for requested information. Requires stage 29 with activity UNPR

to Claimant after Closure. This stage will be used when IRS send a claimant after he case has been closed and the claimant asks for further Stage date may be entered. If it is, it must not be prior to the previous If it is not, Today’s Date will be assumed. A stage 30 must have been Multiple Stages 31 are permitted.

Valid ADP Codes:
Valid Code Sections:
